awd_abstract_narration: The PI plans research on the kinematics and dynamics of                    deformation in plate boundary zones, through field observations(                structural mapping to determine faulting histories and amount and               direction of motion), subsurface observations (including                        measurements of the stress field in various plate tectonic                      settings, particularly around the active plate boundaries), and                 kinematic predictions from plate-tectonic observations.                              An aspect of these studies is the test of kinematic                        predictions, derived from a knowledge of relative plate motions,                compared against the strain history observed along a particular                 plate margin.  Such tests are potentially applicable to many                    plate boundaries, especially the Pacific North American Boundary                and the New Zealand region.  Both areas will be investigated.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE
